replies.body: Is there a way to automatically restrict certain people from joining open parties? I don't always want those random people I friended to join a party with my real friends.

Since Open Parties is a pretty new concept for League, we wanted to start off making it dead simple: it's either open or it's closed. We'll definitely be looking at how players use to to find ways to improve it generally, including whether it makes sense to add more control over who sees it.

Something that could be an easy way around this could be to be able to select which "Folders" of friends in your friends list can see these open games. I use these folder in my friends  list to sort from real friends and friends that I add or add me from random games I play anyway. This uses a feature already in the game so not as much needs to be done.
Yes, there is a button that let's you change it. It's that top right button that is green with a people icon next  to the invite button on it to restrict it.

The button at the top right? I think that is to open/close the party. I was talking about keeping the party open (no invites) but restricting certain people from joining, preferably controllable by folders so I could restrict any in my "random people" folder from joining.

The open party stuff means people from your friend's friends can join, so if you close it then it is just people you invite. I think it's an all or nothing thing where you can't restrict certain people from joining if it's open.

nice to see you guys add voice chat but i gotta ask: why is it only for parties?

Many reasons.
1. Some people are used to playing without it, and have no interest being asked to use it.
2. Imagine how tilting it would be to see a troll inting, _AND_ hear what they have to say.
3. How is Riot going to handle flaming through voice chat? It's an extra layer they don't want to touch.
4. People who aren't used to each other are probably going to argue about strategy. Or there's going to be nitpicking. Complaining. And instead of easy to ignore text chat, it will be voices.
That you should be able to mute..... just saying. {{sticker:sg-ahri-1}}

It's probably the easiest way to test it out with the general public. Once they've run it for a little while, and had the time to bugfix and make changes/improvements, it's quite possible we'll see it brought in on a higher level, such as a staple in all ranked games
true, they could make it team-wide and u can mute them in tab menu.

Because it's infeasible for them to police audio of every game for behavior that is against the rules. By only allowing party members to speak to each other, it prevents most trolls that type obscenities all game from screaming them at you instead.
